sentences.en: ‘Report back to me in an hour, sergeant.’ ‘Yes, sir.’
sentences.cn: “一小时后向我报告，中士。”“是，长官。”

sentences.en: "A pleasure to meet you, sir," he said.
sentences.cn: 他说：“先生，很高兴见到您。”

sentences.en: "Now give me some account of your voyage." — "Very good, sir."
sentences.cn: “现在给我讲述一下你的航程吧。”——“非常乐意，先生。”
“第三突击队已到这里，长官。”——“很好。”

sentences.en: "This Sawtry guy, he is John Sawtry?"— 'Yes. sir. The very same.'
sentences.cn: “这个叫索特里的小伙子，他是约翰·索特里吗？”——“是的，先生。正是他。”

sentences.en: Abbot looked blank. "I don't quite follow, sir."
sentences.cn: 阿博特一脸茫然。“我没听明白，先生。”

sentences.en: Ben Brantley's article on Sir Ian McKellen rekindled many memories.
sentences.cn: 本·布兰特利的那篇关于伊恩·麦凯伦爵士的文章唤起了许多记忆。

sentences.en: I got the impression she'd like a word with you, sir.
sentences.cn: 我觉得她可能想和你谈一谈，先生。

sentences.en: It seemed to me that Sir Robert's arguments were nonsensical.
sentences.cn: 在我看来，罗伯特爵士的争辩纯属瞎说。

sentences.en: Sir Denis took one look and sent it back.
sentences.cn: 丹尼斯爵士看了一眼就把它送了回去。

sentences.en: Sir Geoffrey had no personal animosity towards the Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 杰弗里爵士对首相并无私人恩怨。
杰拉尔德爵士已经被收买了。

sentences.en: Sir Gerald made a small noise in his throat.
sentences.cn: 杰拉尔德爵士从喉咙里发出了点儿声音。

sentences.en: Sir, could you please come to the commanding officer's office?
sentences.cn: 长官，请您到指挥官的办公室来一下好吗？
先生！ 您的钱包掉了。

sentences.en: When will I be released, sir?
sentences.cn: 什么时候放我出去，先生？

phrases.tran_cn: 尊敬的先生或女士（信笺的开头语）

trans.tran_cn: 先生，（用于姓名前）爵士，（中小学生对男教师的称呼）先生，老师
trans.tran_en: used when speaking to a man in order to be polite or show respect
used when speaking to a man in order to be polite or show respect
